Shafi Goldwasser

Biography

Shafi Goldwasser was born in 1958 in the city of New York in the USA. She has family origins from Israel. Early on she began to be fascinated by mathematics and this is why she decided to study an undergraduate degree in mathematics and science at the university of Carnegie Mellon. It was a programming class during her undergraduate studies which lit her eagerness and fire for computer science. As an evident consequence, later on, she pursued a master of science in computer science and eventually a PhD in computer science both at the university of California, Barkley in 1984. Her PhD was supervised by Manuel Blum who was known for bringing up talented individuals in the field of computer science.
This is also where she crossed path for the first time with Silvio Micali with whom she started working and solving an encryption won the Turing Award together in 2012. Goldwasser joint the M.I.T. where she worked on research with different peers one of whom was Silvio Micali. Goldwasser is still a member of the M.I.T. as well as professor in applied mathematics and informatics at the Weizmann-Institute in Israel. She won several prices in the fields of informatics.

Research
